catalogue.name: ReDReSS
catalogue.s-desc: Learning Space Catalogue for ReDReSS: Resource Discovery for Researchers in e-Social Science.

content.dcmi:description: This web page gives an overview of th ESRC / JISC funded ReDReSS Project.
content.dcmi:creator: Audrienne Cutajar Bezzina

content.dcmi:description: This web page forms part of the ReDReSS project web site. There are many acronyms associated with GRID technology, too many to remember. This web page is provided as a reference source for these acronyms. It offers an indexed list, with associated descriptions, of popular GRID Acronyms.
content.dcmi:creator: Audrienne Cutajar Bezzina

content.dcmi:description: Courses at National e-Science Centre (NeSC) - The Training Team at the National e-Science Centre (NeSC) creates and delivers training courses to encourage development, uptake and proficient use of e-Science technologies and infrastructure across industry and public service as well as in many fields of research.
content.dcmi:creator: Various

content.dcmi:description: Humanities and Arts and Social Sciences Research Group Web Site - The Humanities, Arts and Social Science Research Group (HASS-RG) will identify and develop capability for the Humanities, Arts and Social Science with Information Technology on a grid infrastructure.
content.dcmi:creator: Allison Clark
Kevin Franklin

content.dcmi:description: UK High end Computing web site - The aim of the UKHEC initiative is to investigate emerging areas of computing and to inform and provide advice to the user community in hardware and software developments, in new tools, in best practice code development and in data management.
content.dcmi:creator: Various

content.dcmi:description: Distance Learning and Support Document. This is a scientific and technological study undertaken by the ICCC Group a.s , Division HPC, Prague, Czech Republic (ICCC) for the ENACTS network, during the preiod September 2003 – March 2004. ENACTS is a Co-operation Network in the ‘Improving Human Potential Access to Research Infrastructures’ Programme. This Infrastructure Co-operation Network brings together High Performance Computing (HPC), Large Scale Facilities (LSF) funded by the DGXII's IHP programme and key user groups. The aim is to evaluate future trends in the way that computational science will be performed and the pan-European implications.
content.dcmi:creator: Various
